subject: Re: Paranormal State!?
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
I just got to add to FS' point with respect to Paranormal State.  

Anyone notice Ron Milione (TAPS gadget electronics expert) appeared 
on Paranormal State as now a "demon expert," identifying an EVP on 
the show as a "demon" by the sound of its voice on the recording?

Then I saw Ron on the History Channel's UFO Hunters as a UFO 
researcher/expert.  I'm trying to keep count, but that makes him a 
electronics guru, UFO expert and demonologist!  Nice guy, but I think 
he just has a great agent that can get him these "roles."  

Also, I saw a lady have her home investigated by the Penn State bunch 
on Paranormal State and supposedly in need of their help, then I turn 
the channel and see her as a paranormal investigator on Ghost Hunters 
International!  She must have a great agent, too.  ;)

LC  

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> 
wrote:
>
> 
>  At the risk of being negative yet again, all I can say is --You 
have got to be friggin' kidding!? No wonder all the 'serious 
researchers' call it entertainment, cuz shows like that put this work 
back with Barnum and Baily! I think they take urban myths, like the 
haunted piano, and do a show on it, with all actors. Their 
demonolgist supposedly worked on the Amityville case, ya mean the 
Hollywood version, cuz the real case was nothin!?  Just watch the 
people involved, and you can tell they are actors, with speech 
training, not a single um, ah, or stutter ever uttered! It's all just 
too well rehearshed and scripted for me to watch any more of it.
